sources.title: Afonya
sources.description:
Georgiy Daneliya’s famous comedy is a kind, funny, and at the same time a sad story about a hopeless plumber Afanasy ‘Afonya’ Borshchov, who fills his life with dubious ”exploits,“ new acquaintances, and booze. Although Afonya has no respect for work, his coworkers and Katya, a girl in love with him, hope that Afanasy will change for the better. After all, he’s not doing anything wrong - he’s just being indifferent. Can anything spark his seemingly dormant heart? 

A film about the transience of time, the need for choice, and love. The highest grossing Soviet film of 1975 (62.2 million viewers). A golden cast of the USSR.

Year of production: 1975

Directed by: Georgiy Daneliya 
Written by: Alexander Borodyansky
Director of photography: Sergei Vronsky
Music: Mieczysław Weinberg 
Production designer: Boris Nemechek 
Starring: Leonid Kuravlyov, Yevgeniya Simonova, Yevgeny Leonov

The film was digitally restored by Mosfilm Cinema Concern

metadata.Plot: The 1975 film by Georgi Daneliya "Afonya" was an unexpected commercial hit in USSR. The main character Borshev A.N. is a Plumber who spends his free time, as well as working hours, drinking with his buddies whom he even doesn't recognize the next day after another heavy drink. His girlfriend leaves him, his boss places him on probation, his whole life is falling a part but he doesn't realize it. There is only one person who can save him - a nurse by the name Katya whom he met at a disco and didn't pay much attention to... Daneliya manages to balance in the film satire and drama, quotes from the film gained a cult status in Russia and other former countries of USSR.
